intro: Cremanthodium bulbilliferum, commonly known as the bulbilliferous sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically succulent, adapted to the arid and cold conditions of its habitat. Cremanthodium bulbilliferum is known for its unique reproductive structures, including bulbils that aid in vegetative propagation.
